paper_abstract: The problem addressed in this paper is the decision problem of determining if a set of multidimensional rectangular boxes can be orthogonally packed into a rectangular bin while satisfying the requirement that the packing should be guillotine cuttable. That is, there should exist a series of face parallel straight cuts that can recursively cut the bin into pieces so that each piece contains a box and no box has been intersected by a cut. The unrestricted problem is known to be NP-hard. In this paper we present a generalization of a constructive algorithm for the multi-dimensional bin packing problem, with and without the guillotine constraint, based on constraint programming. paper_title: Multi-dimensional bin packing problems with guillotine constraints
